description: Controlled vocabulary for site tagging, filtering, and pricing. All sites are math-education related — no 'education' tag needed.

geographic.description: Where the organization primarily operates or the audience it serves.

scale.description: The size and reach of the organization.

traffic.description: Estimated web traffic / audience reach. Based on participation numbers, Google Trends, and site analytics where available.

features.description: Notable features of the site itself.

complexity.description: Describes how complex the website redesign is. Used instead of pricing tiers — complexity directly informs fair pricing based on actual work involved.

simple.label: Simple
simple.description: 1–3 pages, mostly informational. Minimal interactivity. Basic layout with standard sections (hero, about, contact). No forms, no e-commerce, no dynamic content.

moderate.label: Moderate
moderate.description: 4–7 pages with some interactive elements. May include registration links, pricing tables, FAQ accordions, image galleries, or external e-commerce integration. Multiple distinct content types across pages.
examples: Camp site with schedule and registration

complex.label: Complex
complex.description: 8–15+ pages with significant interactivity. Includes features like user authentication, CMS integration, dynamic results/leaderboards, payment processing, member portals, or multi-step registration flows. Multiple interconnected systems.
examples: Full competition platform with live results

enterprise.label: Enterprise
enterprise.description: Large-scale site with 15+ pages, custom application logic, database-driven content, API integrations, admin dashboards, role-based access, and/or multi-tenant architecture. Essentially a web application, not just a website.
examples: National competition platform with school dashboards

organizationTypes.description: The legal/operational structure of the client organization.

statuses.description: Lifecycle status of the site redesign project.
